alert.note: Alert for Dane; Dodge; Jefferson; Rock; Washington (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 1:51AM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...Outflow from a broken line of thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Green, Walworth, Rock, western Racine, Waukesha, eastern Dane, southern Washington, Jefferson, southern Dodge and western Kenosha Counties through 245 AM CDT... At 149 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Waterloo to Lake Koshkonong to 7 miles southeast of Monroe. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...MSN ASOS report a peak wind gust of 49 mph at 132 AM CDT. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Madison, Waukesha, Janesville, New Berlin, Brookfield, Beloit, Menomonee Falls, Sun Prairie, Fitchburg, Muskego, Watertown, Whitewater, Hartford, Pewaukee, Stoughton, Fort Atkinson, Sussex, Elkhorn, Oregon, and Hartland. This includes the following highways... Interstate 39/90/94 between mile markers 130 and 137. U.S. Highway 12 between mile markers 260 and 273, and between mile markers 320 and 338. U.S. Highway 151 between mile markers 98 and 113. Interstate 39/90 between mile markers 138 and 186. Interstate 94 between mile markers 241 and 302. Wisconsin Highway 26 between mile markers 6 and 50. Interstate 43 between mile markers 0 and 58. Interstate 41 between mile markers 50 and 63. U.S. Highway 45 between mile markers 61 and 63. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
